\#\#Question 6 Create a new variable modern, which is equal to `yes'
when the year published is greater than or equal to 2000, and is equal
to `no' when the year published is less than 2000.

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{df3 }\OtherTok{\textless{}{-}}\NormalTok{ df }\CommentTok{\#Duplicate the dataframe}
\NormalTok{Above\_2000 }\OtherTok{\textless{}{-}}\NormalTok{ df3}\SpecialCharTok{$}\NormalTok{year\_of\_release }\SpecialCharTok{\textgreater{}=} \DecValTok{2000} \CommentTok{\# create the vector for year of release tha is greater than 2000}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\#\#Question 9 For each rating (E, E10+, T and M), find the most common
genre.

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\FunctionTok{table}\NormalTok{(df}\SpecialCharTok{$}\NormalTok{rating)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## 
##    E E10+    M    T 
##  784  280  228  531
\end{verbatim}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\FunctionTok{library}\NormalTok{(dplyr)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## 
## Attaching package: 'dplyr'
\end{verbatim}

\begin{verbatim}
## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
## 
##     filter, lag
\end{verbatim}

\begin{verbatim}
## The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
## 
##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
\end{verbatim}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\CommentTok{\# Group the data by rating and calculate the mode (most common genre)}
\NormalTok{mode\_genre\_by\_rating }\OtherTok{\textless{}{-}}\NormalTok{ df }\SpecialCharTok{\%\textgreater{}\%}
  \FunctionTok{group\_by}\NormalTok{(rating) }\SpecialCharTok{\%\textgreater{}\%}
  \FunctionTok{summarize}\NormalTok{(}\AttributeTok{mode\_genre =} \FunctionTok{names}\NormalTok{(}\FunctionTok{sort}\NormalTok{(}\FunctionTok{table}\NormalTok{(genre), }\AttributeTok{decreasing =} \ConstantTok{TRUE}\NormalTok{)[}\DecValTok{1}\NormalTok{]))}
  \CommentTok{\#we calculate the mode (most common genre) using the table function, which counts the frequency of each genre, and then we use sort to sort the table in decreasing     order}
\CommentTok{\# Print the result}
\FunctionTok{print}\NormalTok{(mode\_genre\_by\_rating)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## # A tibble: 4 x 2
##   rating mode_genre
##   <chr>  <chr>     
## 1 E      Sports    
## 2 E10+   Action    
## 3 M      Action    
## 4 T      Action
\end{verbatim}

\#\#Question 10 Find the average (mean) critic score in each genre, for
genres where we have at least 100 games. Arrange from highest average
critic score to lowest.

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\FunctionTok{table}\NormalTok{(df}\SpecialCharTok{$}\NormalTok{genre)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## 
##       Action    Adventure     Fighting         Misc     Platform       Puzzle 
##          454           37          110          101           90           16 
##       Racing Role-Playing      Shooter   Simulation       Sports     Strategy 
##          147           39          143           86          583           17
\end{verbatim}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\CommentTok{\#sort the value counts}
\NormalTok{mode\_genre }\OtherTok{\textless{}{-}} \FunctionTok{sort}\NormalTok{(}\FunctionTok{table}\NormalTok{(df}\SpecialCharTok{$}\NormalTok{genre), }\AttributeTok{decreasing =} \ConstantTok{TRUE}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{mode\_genre}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## 
##       Sports       Action       Racing      Shooter     Fighting         Misc 
##          583          454          147          143          110          101 
##     Platform   Simulation Role-Playing    Adventure     Strategy       Puzzle 
##           90           86           39           37           17           16
\end{verbatim}

I'll find mean critic score for the following genres -Sports -Action
-Racing -Shooter -Fighting -Misc

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\NormalTok{Valid\_genre }\OtherTok{\textless{}{-}}\NormalTok{ mode\_genre}\SpecialCharTok{\textgreater{}=} \DecValTok{100}
\NormalTok{Valid\_genre}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{verbatim}
## 
##       Sports       Action       Racing      Shooter     Fighting         Misc 
##         TRUE         TRUE         TRUE         TRUE         TRUE         TRUE 
##     Platform   Simulation Role-Playing    Adventure     Strategy       Puzzle 
##        FALSE        FALSE        FALSE        FALSE        FALSE        FALSE
\end{verbatim}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\FunctionTok{library}\NormalTok{(dplyr)}
\NormalTok{df7 }\OtherTok{\textless{}{-}}\NormalTok{ df }\SpecialCharTok{\%\textgreater{}\%} 
  \FunctionTok{group\_by}\NormalTok{(genre) }\SpecialCharTok{\%\textgreater{}\%} 
  \FunctionTok{filter}\NormalTok{(}\FunctionTok{n}\NormalTok{() }\SpecialCharTok{\textgreater{}=} \DecValTok{100}\NormalTok{)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\FunctionTok{library}\NormalTok{(dplyr)}
\CommentTok{\# Group the data by genre and calculate the mean critic score}
\NormalTok{mean\_critic\_by\_genre }\OtherTok{\textless{}{-}}\NormalTok{ df7 }\SpecialCharTok{\%\textgreater{}\%}
  \FunctionTok{group\_by}\NormalTok{(genre) }\SpecialCharTok{\%\textgreater{}\%}
   \FunctionTok{summarize}\NormalTok{(}\AttributeTok{mean\_critic\_by\_genre =} \FunctionTok{names}\NormalTok{(}\FunctionTok{sort}\NormalTok{(}\FunctionTok{mean}\NormalTok{(df7}\SpecialCharTok{$}\NormalTok{critic\_score), }\AttributeTok{decreasing =} \ConstantTok{TRUE}\NormalTok{)[}\DecValTok{1}\NormalTok{]))}
\FunctionTok{print}\NormalTok{(mean\_critic\_by\_genre)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}
